intro: Microgonium benlii, commonly known as the Benlii microgonium, is a rare aquatic plant native to specific regions in East Asia. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique reproductive structures. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in marshy areas. Its botanical significance lies in its role in maintaining ecological balance within its habitat. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
